#211

- Growing gregariously on open mixed oak/hickory woodland ridge.
- Nearby Trees: Bitternut Hickory, Black Oak, Chinkapin Oak, AMerican Hophornbeam, Ash, and Elm.
- Cap funnel shaped, primarily white with yellow to brown areas. Leaves stuck to pileipellis (viscid?)
- Lamellae attached to stipe to slightly running down, white with brown speckling.
- Stipe collapsible (maybe due to insect damage), short compared to size of cap.
- Smell: Not distinctive.
- Taste: Mildly acrid (spicy).
